intro: Eutrema lancifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved iceplant, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to saline and arid environments. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is known for its diverse array of succulent species. Eutrema lancifolium is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
